Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.add_process_time_header(request: Request, call_next)¶

Middleware that measures request handling time and adds header “X-Process-Time” with measured value to the response.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) – Incoming HTTP request.

  • call_next (function) – Next middleware handler.

Returns:

Response with added header.

Return type:

Response

main.read_root()¶

Returns short description what this API to do.

Returns:

Message.

Return type:

dict

async main.startup()¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Delete a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • note_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • user (User) – The user to delete the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The deleted contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_birthdays_along_week(user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contact with the birthday along week from the current date for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts with the birthday which is matched to the needed condition.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_email(contact_email: str, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified email for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_email (str) – The lastname of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The contact with the specified email, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_id(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_lastname(contact_lastname: str, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contact with the specified lastname for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_lastname (str) – The lastname of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts with the specified name.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_name(contact_name: str, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contact with the specified name for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_name (str) – The name of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts with the specified name.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The updated data for the contact.

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to update.

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Calls when user confirms his own email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – User email address.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Nothing

Return type:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Creates a new user in system which can manage hist own contacts.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The data for the user to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

Retrieves an user with the unique specific email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address to retrieve user for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

An user which is identified by email address.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.reset_password_new(user: User, password: str, db: Session) → None¶

Calls to set a new password instead old forgotten one.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – User who wants to reset password.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Nothing

Return type:

None

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Updates a refresh token for specific user if token is present. Otherwise (if it is None) token is removed.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – User to update his refresh token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Nothing

Return type:

None

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Updates refresh token for specific user if token is present. Otherwise (if it is None) token is removed.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – User to update his refresh token

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Nothing

Return type:

None

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Creates new contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – Contact data.

  • current_user (User) – Current user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

contact

Return type:

ResponseContactModel

Raises:

HTTPException – This exception is raised when such contact already exists.

For example, use Postman POST request to URL=…/contacts/ with the following JSON raw body to create new contact:
{
“name”: “Lara”,
“lastname”: “Craft”,
“email”: “LaraCraft@gmail.com”,
“phone”: “(304) 625-2000”,
“birthday”: “2001-11-27”,
“note”: “The game must be continued.”
}
async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Deletes an existent contact with a specific ID for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of contact to delete.

  • current_user (User) – Current user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

contact

Return type:

ResponseContactModel

Raises:

HTTPException – This exception is raised when contact is absent.

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact_birthdays_along_week(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for the current user with birtdays which are happened during near 7 days.

Parameters:

  • current_user (User) – Current user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

List of contacts

Return type:

List[ResponseContactModel]

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact_email(contact_email: str = Path(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieves a contact with a specific email for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The case insencitive email address of the contact.

  • current_user (User) – Current user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Suitable contact

Return type:

ResponseContactModel

Raises:

HTTPException – If a contact is absent for the current user, then exception with HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND status is raised.

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact_id(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieves a contact with specific ID for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact.

  • current_user (User) – Current user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Suitable contact

Return type:

ResponseContactModel

Raises:

HTTPException – If a contact is absent for the current user, then exception with HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND status is raised.

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact_lastname(contact_lastname: str = Path(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for the current user with a specific contact lastname.

Parameters:

  • contact_lastname (str) – Case insensitive contact lastname.

  • current_user (User) – Current user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

List of contacts

Return type:

List[ResponseContactModel]

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact_name(contact_name: str = Path(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for the current user with a specific contact name.

Parameters:

  • contact_name (str) – Case insensitive contact name.

  • current_user (User) – Current user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

List of contacts

Return type:

List[ResponseContactModel]

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for the current user. Call of this function is rate limited.

Parameters:

  • current_user (User) – Current user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

List of contacts

Return type:

List[ResponseContactModel]

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Updates an existent contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – New contact data.

  • current_user (User) – Current user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

contact

Return type:

ResponseContactModel

Raises:

HTTPException – This exception is raised when contact data already exists for the other contact or contact is absent.

Parameters:

current_user (User) – Current user.

Returns:

Curreny user database record.

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Update current user avatar and save it into cloudinary cloud.

Parameters:

  • current_user (User) – Current user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Curent user database record.

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirms user’s email address. This function is called from verification email which is sent to user.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – Access token from header “Authorization: Bearer TOKEN_STRING”.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Result information about email is confirmed.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If user’s access token is wrong, then exception with HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED status code is raised.

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Login procedure for existent user.

Parameters:

body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – User credentials from form-data.

Returns:

Result information and access/refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

Raises:

HTTPException – If user is absent, or user email is not confirmed, or user password is wrong then exception with HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED status code is raised.

For example, use Postman POST request to URL=…/…/auth/login with the following x-www-form-urlencoded body:
username=roybebru@gmail.com
password=123456
async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Updates access and refresh tokens.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) –

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Result information and access/refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

Raises:

HTTPException – If user’s refresh token is different from such token in given credentials, then exception with HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED status code is raised.

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Sends verification email to user.

Parameters:

  • body – User’s email.

  • body – RequstEmail

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Fastapi interface to background tasks.

  • request (Request) – An interface onto the incoming request to get base_url, etc.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Result information.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.reset_password(body: ResetPasswordModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

As soon as the user requests to reset the forgotten password, this function will be called. If the user exists and his email address is confirmed, an email with a password change form must be sent to this user.

Parameters:

  • body (ResetPasswordModel) – User’s email from request body..

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Fastapi interface to background tasks.

  • request (Request) – An interface onto the incoming request to get base_url, etc.

Returns:

Message about success.

Return type:

ResponseResetPasswordModel

Raises:

HTTPException – If user is absent, or user email is not confirmed, then exception with HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED status code is raised.

For example, use Postman POST request to URL=…/…/auth/reset_password with the following JSON raw body:
{
“email”: “roybebru@gmail.com”
}
async src.routes.auth.reset_password_new(token: str, password: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

As soon as the user enters a new password in the HTML form in the email and sends it, this function is called.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – Email token to prevent password changing from unauthorized user.

  • password (str) – Plain password from form field in html email.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Message about success password changing.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If token is wrong or outdated and email cannot be given then exception with HTTP_406_NOT_ACCEPTABLE is raised.

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Signs a new user up and sends him a verification email in background with a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – User credentials from request body.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Fastapi interface to background tasks.

  • request (Request) – An interface onto the incoming request to get base_url, etc.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Result information, including new_user object and text message.

Return type:

ResponseUserModel

For example, use Postman POST request to URL=…/…/auth/signup with the following JSON raw body:
{
“username”: “Roy Bebru”,
“email”: “roybebru@gmail.com”,
“password”: “123456”
}

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'HERO_SECRET_KEY'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Creates access token with specific data within it.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Data dictionary to include into access token. For example, {“sub”: “RoyBebru@gmail.com”}.

  • expires_delta (float) – Optional time while access token is valid. If expires_delta is omitted then default value is 15 minutes.

Returns:

Access token

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict, days=7)¶

Creates email token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Data dictionary which must be included within token.

  • days (int) – Days while token is valid. By default it is 7 days.

Returns:

Email token.

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Creates refresh token with specific data within it.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Data dictionary to include into refresh token. For example, {“sub”: “RoyBebru@gmail.com”}.

  • expires_delta (float) – Optional time while refresh token is valid. If expires_delta is omitted then default value is 7 days.

Returns:

Refresh token

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

Decodes a refresh token.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – Refresh token in aim to decode.

Raises:

HTTPExpression – Exception is raised if refresh token has wrong format, or is outdated.

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieve a current user by given access token If token is good user can be retrieced from redis cache.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – Access token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Curent user.

Return type:

User

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

Retrieves user email address which is stored within access or update token.

Parameters:

token (str) – Given access or update token.

Returns:

User’s email address.

Return type:

str | None

Raises:

HTTPException – If token is wrong exception with HTTP_422_UNPROCESSIBLE_ENTITY status is raised.

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

Retrieves the hash of the plain password.

Parameters:

password (str) – Plain password.

Returns:

Hashed password.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
rds = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password: str, hashed_password: str)¶

Compares passwords.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – Given plain password.

  • hashed_password (str) – Given hashed password.

Returns:

True if password is the same.

Return type:

bool

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email_reset_password(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Sends email with form to change password directly from mailer. Offen it planned as bacground task.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – Email address for sending.

  • username (str) – Nickname of user who must receive email.

  • host (str) – URL which must wait respond.

Returns:

Nothing.

Return type:

None

async src.services.email.send_email_verification(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Sends verification email. Offen it planned as bacground task.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – Email address for sending.

  • username (str) – Nickname of user who must receive verification email.

  • host (str) – URL which must wait verification respond.

Returns:

Nothing.

Return type:

None
